content.text:
[@keks](@YXkE3TikkY4GFMX3lzXUllRkNTbj5E+604AkaO1xbz8=.ed25519)

I'm sure this would be better to test in Scuttlebutt, but here are my results with GnuPG:

```console
$ gpg -ser alice |wc -c    
Hello world
673
$ gpg -ser alice -r bob | wc -c 
Hello world
942
$ gpg -ser alice -r bob -r carol | wc -c
Hello world
1215
```

Looks like it increases by 40% when you add a second person and 29% when you add a third person. You're right, definitely not "~double" like I said.
